name: Agriculture is King
title: Dominant Agricultural Land Use
description: In 2022, 84.55% of Turkmenistan's land area was dedicated to agriculture, showcasing its reliance on agricultural activities.

name: Fossil Fuel Reliance
title: 100% Fossil Fuel Energy Consumption
description: As of 2022, Turkmenistan's energy consumption was entirely dependent on fossil fuels, with no renewable energy contribution.

name: Healthcare Paradox
title: High Out-of-Pocket Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, 79.22% of health expenditure was out-of-pocket, despite 100% prenatal care coverage in 2019.

name: Education Equality
title: Balanced Gender Labor Force Participation
description: By 2024, Turkmenistan achieved a female-to-male labor force participation rate of 104.66%, indicating gender balance in employment.

name: Corruption Concerns
title: Low Control of Corruption
description: In 2022, Turkmenistan ranked low in controlling corruption, with a percentile rank of 0.47.

name: Aid Dynamics
title: Negative Aid Flow from Norway
description: In 2019, Turkmenistan experienced a negative net bilateral aid flow of -$19,999.99 from Norway.

name: Data Services Lag
title: Low Statistical Performance
description: In 2023, Turkmenistan's data services scored 0.47 out of 100, indicating a need for improvement in statistical capabilities.

name: Salt Savvy
title: High Iodized Salt Consumption
description: In 2015, 99.7% of households in Turkmenistan consumed iodized salt, promoting better health outcomes.

name: Trade Ties
title: Significant Imports from Europe & Central Asia
description: In 2023, 45.24% of Turkmenistan's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies in Europe & Central Asia.

name: Rural Sanitation Success
title: Minimal Open Defecation in Rural Areas
description: By 2018, only 0.0026% of the rural population practiced open defecation, indicating strong sanitation measures.

name: Voice and Accountability
title: Low Voice and Accountability Rank
description: In 2023, Turkmenistan had a low percentile rank of 0.49 in voice and accountability, highlighting governance challenges.
